resources.string: Hi! My name is Jeroen and I developed this app in the first weeks that I became vegan. I found it annoying to browse websites in the store to find out whether products were vegan or not. With this app, I hope to support others in their quest for an animal-friendly lifestyle. \n\nA list like this will never be finished nor flawless. If you miss information or find an error, please let me know by sending an email to contactisitvegan@gmail.com.
Agar, or agar-agar, is a jelly-like substance, obtained from red algae. It is often used as a substitute for gelatin.
Angora wool is a soft fibre that comes from the domestic Angora rabbit. Soft, warm sweaters are made from this material.
Beeswax, Cera alba or Cera flava is wax made by bees. It is used in candy, cosmetics and candles.
Bone char is an animal charcoal. It is made by heating bones.
Butterfat is the fat in dairy. It is the natural constituent of cows\' milk and it is used to make butter.
Buttermilk is an end product of skimmed milk. A conversion from lactose to lactic acid takes place by means of lactic acid bacteria. This creates buttermilk.
Calcium 5\'-ribonucleotides is a mixture of calcium salts of guanylic and insinic acid. Both of these are often produces in a vegan way.

Calcium guanylate is a guanylic acid. Guanylic acid is a building block of RNA, an important component in the functioning of living cells and is found in animals, plants and bacteria. It is used as a flavor enhancer in foods. Guanylic acid is often added to savory products such as stock cubes, ready-to-eat noodles and crisps. Guanylic acid can be isolated from sardines, but can also be produced in a vegan way from yeast. Major producers have indicated that they use vegan-produced guanylic acid.

Calcium inosinate is a calcium salt of inosinic acid. Inosinic acid is a substance that occurs naturally in both plants and animals and plays a role in the metabolism of cells. It is used as a flavor enhancer in foods. Inosinic acid is often added to savory products such as stock cubes, ready-to-eat noodles and chips. Inosinic acid can be isolated from meat and fish, but can also be produced in a vegan way. Major producers have indicated that they use vegan-produced inosinic acid.
Carmine is a bright red dye made from beetles. It is often used to color food, cosmetics and textiles.
Casein is an animal protein found mainly in dairy products.
Cashmere is a fabric made from the fur of goats.
Castoreum comes from beaver scent glands and is used as a flavoring in foods and cigarettes and as a fragrance in perfumes.
Beeswax, Cera alba or Cera flava is wax made by bees. It is used in candy, cosmetics and candles.
Beeswax, Cera alba or Cera flava is wax made by bees. It is used in candy, cosmetics and candles.
Cacao butter is the fat contained in cocoa beans.
Coir or coconut fiber is a natural fiber extracted from the outer husk of coconut. It is used in products such as floor mats, doormats, brushes and mattresses.
Cotton is a natural fibre from cotton plants and is used to produce material for clothing and other textile products.

Fatty acid mono- and diglycerides are synthetic fats obtained from glycerol and natural fatty acids. The fatty acids can be of animal or vegetable origin. In practice, it is almost always vegetable fat.
Disodium 5\'-ribonucleotides is a mixture of calcium salts of guanylic and insinic acid. Both of these are often produces in a vegan way.

Disodium guanylate is a guanylic acid. Guanylic acid is a building block of RNA, an important component in the functioning of living cells and is found in animals, plants and bacteria. It is used as a flavor enhancer in foods. Guanylic acid is often added to savory products such as stock cubes, ready-to-eat noodles and crisps. Guanylic acid can be isolated from sardines, but can also be produced in a vegan way from yeast. Major producers have indicated that they use vegan-produced guanylic acid.

Disodium inosinate is a disodium salt of inosinic acid. Inosinic acid is a substance that occurs naturally in both plants and animals and plays a role in the metabolism of cells. It is used as a flavor enhancer in foods. Inosinic acid is often added to savory products such as stock cubes, ready-to-eat noodles and chips. Inosinic acid can be isolated from meat and fish, but can also be produced in a vegan way. Major producers have indicated that they use vegan-produced inosinic acid.
Despite its name, eggplants do not actually contain eggs. They thank their name due to their shape.

Gelatin is a protein obtained by boiling skin, tendons, ligaments, and bones with water. It is usually obtained from cows or pigs. Gelatin is used in cosmetics; as a thickener for puddings; in candies, cakes, ice cream, and yogurts; on photographic film; in vitamins as a coating and as capsules, and it is sometimes used to assist in “clearing” wines.

Glycerol or Glycerine is a colorless sugar alcohol. It is a natural constituent of fats, both natural and vegetable. Glycerol is mainly extracted during the production of biodiesel, but sometimes also from animal fat. The substance is used in paint, cosmetics, food, perfume and explosives, among others. Most manufacturers cannot properly identify the source. In practice, glycerol usually appears to come from a vegetable source.

Guanylic acid or guanosine monophosphate (GMP) is a building block of RNA, an important component in the functioning of living cells, and is found in animals, plants and bacteria. It is used as a flavor enhancer in foods. Guanylic acid is often added to savory products such as stock cubes, ready-to-eat noodles and crisps. Guanylic acid can be isolated from sardines, but can also be produced in a vegan way from yeast. Major producers have indicated that they use vegan-produced guanylic acid.

Guanylic acid or guanosine monophosphate (GMP) is a building block of RNA, an important component in the functioning of living cells, and is found in animals, plants and bacteria. It is used as a flavor enhancer in foods. Guanylic acid is often added to savory products such as stock cubes, ready-to-eat noodles and crisps. Guanylic acid can be isolated from sardines, but can also be produced in a vegan way from yeast. Major producers have indicated that they use vegan-produced guanylic acid.

Hemp was one of the first plants to be spun into usable fiber 50,000 years ago. It can be refined into a variety of commercial items, including paper, textiles, clothing, biodegradable plastics, paint, insulation, biofuel, food, and animal feed.

Honey is the sweet substance made by honey bees from the nectar of flowers. Honey is removed from the hive by beekeepers. The bees receive sugar water in return. Just like honey, this is nice and sweet, but lacks important nutrients for the bee that honey contains. The sugar water weakens the bees; they become more susceptible to fungal infections, mites and viruses.

Inosinic acid or inosine monophosphate (IMP) is a substance that occurs naturally in both plants and animals and plays a role in the metabolism of cells. It is used as a flavor enhancer in foods. Inosinic acid is often added to savory products such as stock cubes, ready-to-eat noodles and chips. Inosinic acid can be isolated from meat and fish, but can also be produced in a vegan way. Major producers have indicated that they use vegan-produced inosinic acid.

Inosinic acid or inosine monophosphate (IMP) is a substance that occurs naturally in both plants and animals and plays a role in the metabolism of cells. It is used as a flavor enhancer in foods. Inosinic acid is often added to savory products such as stock cubes, ready-to-eat noodles and chips. Inosinic acid can be isolated from meat and fish, but can also be produced in a vegan way. Major producers have indicated that they use vegan-produced inosinic acid.

Keratin is often added to hair products in order to repair damaged hair, and sometimes keep hair straight. Keratin comes from ground up animal hair, horns, hooves, and feathers. You can’t find keratine directly in a plant, but it can be synthesized from amino acids extracted from plants. This is rare, however.
L-Cysteine is an amino acid that is used as a bread improver. It is often made from goose and duck feathers. Increasingly, L-Cysteine is produced with the help of bacteria.

L-Cystine is the oxidized form of the amino acid L-Cysteine. Both are used as a bread improver. L-Cysteine is often made from goose and duck feathers. Increasingly, L-Cysteine is produced with the help of bacteria.
Most lactic acid is vegan, as it primarily occurs during the natural fermentation process of plants or is man-made using plants.
Lactitol is a synthetic sugar alcohol made from milk sugar (lactose), obtained from whey. It is common in bakery products and confectionery.
Lactobacillus probiotics are generally vegan, as they are bacteria — not an animal product. However, the probiotics may be cultured with dairy.
Lactose is a sugar found in diary products.

Lard is animal fat, mainly from the pork belly. Lard is obtained by melting the bacon. What remains is the melted fat and non-meltable leftovers, the so-called cracklings. Lard can also come from suet.

Latex is made naturally (from a rubber tree) or synthetically (from petroleum). However, dipped latex products, such as condoms, balloons, and latex gloves, often use the milk protein casein in the production process. Casein is an animal product.

Lecithin is a compound that occurs in every living organism because it is part of the cell wall of every cell. Lecithin for commercial use is extracted from soybeans, sunflower seeds, rapeseed and (nowadays relatively rare) egg yolk.
Linen is made from the fibers of the flax plant.
Lyocell is a form of rayon. It consists of cellulose fibre. The fibre is used to make textiles for clothing and other purposes.
Modal is a type of rayon, a fabric made from plant cellulose.

Fatty acid mono- and diglycerides are synthetic fats obtained from glycerol and natural fatty acids. The fatty acids can be of animal or vegetable origin. In practice, it is almost always vegetable fat.
Musk is extracted from the musk deer that lives in the Himalayas and Tibet. It is a strongly scented substance often used in perfume.

Pearls are created by oysters. Most pearls are cultured. This means that an irritant is implanted into the oyster shell. Subsequently, the oysters coates the irritant with the crystalline substance nacre and the pearl is harvested.

Potassium guanylate is a guanylic acid. Guanylic acid is a building block of RNA, an important component in the functioning of living cells and is found in animals, plants and bacteria. It is used as a flavor enhancer in foods. Guanylic acid is often added to savory products such as stock cubes, ready-to-eat noodles and crisps. Guanylic acid can be isolated from sardines, but can also be produced in a vegan way from yeast. Major producers have indicated that they use vegan-produced guanylic acid.

Potassium inosinate is a potassium salt of inosinic acid. Inosinic acid is a substance that occurs naturally in both plants and animals and plays a role in the metabolism of cells. It is used as a flavor enhancer in foods. Inosinic acid is often added to savory products such as stock cubes, ready-to-eat noodles and chips. Inosinic acid can be isolated from meat and fish, but can also be produced in a vegan way. Major producers have indicated that they use vegan-produced inosinic acid.
Powdered milk or dried milk is a manufactured dairy product made by evaporating milk to dryness.

Shellac is a glazing agent made from the secretions of the female lac bug. In foods it is used as a wax coating and is known under the name E904. It is used with fruits, bonbons and candies. Shellac is also used in silicones, furniture wax, coatings and in the pharmaceutical industry.
Seaweeds are plants that grow in the sea. They contain an impressive range of nourishing ingredients.
Silk fabrics are made from the silk that silkworms spin for the cocoon in which they turn into butterflies.

Skatol is an organic compound with a very strong and unpleasant odor. It occurs naturally in the feces of mammals and birds. It is an aroma substance that is used (in very small quantities) in the preparation of certain perfumes.

Lecithin is a compound that occurs in every living organism because it is part of the cell wall of every cell. Lecithin for commercial use is extracted from soybeans, sunflower seeds, rapeseed and (nowadays relatively rare) egg yolk.
The soybean is a legume derived from the soybean plant, which is used as a raw material for many soy products.

Lecithin is a compound that occurs in every living organism because it is part of the cell wall of every cell. Lecithin for commercial use is extracted from soybeans, sunflower seeds, rapeseed and (nowadays relatively rare) egg yolk.
Tallow is animal fat derived from sheep and cattle. It is used in many cosmetic products, especially creams and lotions. It is a greasy substance that retains moisture.

Vanilla is a sweet, smooth aroma of which vanillin is the main ingredient. Vanilla can consist of both natural vanilla and vanillin. A vanilla-like flavor can be made with the use of castoreum, but this is rare.
Vitamin D2 (ergocalciferol) is almost always vegan. The vegetable ergosterol is converted into ergocalciferol under the influence of UV light. Vitamin D2 can also be produced by fungi.
Vitamin D3 (cholecalciferol) can be derived from an animal source (such as sheep’s wool) or a vegan-friendly source (lichen).
Whey is a by-product of cheese production.
Whey powder comes from whey, a by-product of cheese preparation.
Whey protein comes from whey, a by-product of cheese production.
Wool is a textile fibre that is obtained from the fleece, hide or fur from animals. These animals may include sheep, goats and alpacas. It is used to produce textiles.
Wool fat (lanoline) is a yellowish sebum secreted by sebaceous glands on the skin of sheep.
